page.title: 14Local History
page.content: Newtown and St.Boswells have many historical connections.Standing in the shadow of the Eildon Hills we are reminded of the Roman connection. On Hill North was the Iron Age settlement of the Selgovae tribe which later gave way to a Roman signal station.Dere Street, the Roman road,forms part of the present A68. Some Newtown inhabitants have been known to be incensed by the commonly held belief that,as its name implies, it is a recent settlement.In fact records from as far abck as 1530 establish Newtown as a thriving settlement.Both villages do have connections with abbeys.St.Boswells with St.Boisil who came with St.Aidan to Melrose,and Newtown with Dryburgh Abbey whose tenants brought grain to Newtown Corn Mill.
